history.text: hello, this is my first time doing this but It looks like 6.8 out of 10 people enjoyed this movie
Hello, so did you like the movie Monster's University? Did you think it was as good as Monsters inc.
It's my first time also.
Yes, it seems Rotten Tomatoes gave it a 79%.
I think the movie was okay I believe the original was better but that could be because of the age gap when both movies where made
Who was your favorite character?  I like Sulley.
it's cool that this one was offered in 3D
Yes the 12 year difference between the first and second movie made it difficult for some people to remember the previous movie.
yeah it was hard to forget my little sister literally watched it 100 times
I also thought it was interesting that this movie showed the relationship between Mike and Sulley prior to monsters  inc.
yes that is a different perspective for sure
it's also cool it showed the monsters when they where younger as well
So I can see how Mike doesn't have what it really takes for scaring the kids.
Sully definitely has more of a scare factor and I can see why he was able to join Roar Omega Roar.
yes and only sulley made it in the roar sorority
they got into a fight because of it
and broke the cherished scream can
Yes, I think that it shows that even with talent you have to work hard to be successful as sully failed when he didn't study enough.
but all in all, they both had their pros and cons Sulley never studied and mike wasn't scary enough
yes lol
mike joined the weakest sorority
Mike wanted to be scary he just didn't have it in him, he only won the game as Sully changed the difficulty level to easiest.
IT was lucky that they made it to the next round due to a team cheating that left them disqualified.
yup sulley tampered with the machine
Sulley joined Mike's team also as a way to get back into the scare program after failing out.
It was great how they beat roar omega roar at the end even if it was due to tampering of the machine.
yeah I agree
they got led away by the cda
and become expelled
Yeah it's a bummer that they both were kicked out of school.
they had to start over at monster's inc in the mail room and worked up to being scarer's.
yeah but that's how they made their way to monsters ink is because they got kicked out
and they worked in the mail center at first
but than made their way to the scare team
Yes, unfortunately the rest of the team, was able to go into the scare program.
yup overall I think the scene selection was mild and slow compared to the original
I think it's hard to write the prequel with so much time from the original.
It then captures a whole different audience and loses it's original youngsters that initially loved the first movie and then had outgrown seeing this one.
I think movies need to be closer together so they can retain some of the same audience along with gain new followers.
i agree
Do you ever watch movies based on their scores or ratings?
yes I don't watch them in theaters so if I going to pay to watch them I want to know there good
not sure what to do now.....
hello
hello
